tweet: The humanitarian crisis at our southern border needs more than just additional resources—it needs ACCOUNTABILITY to address the abuse and negligence of the federal government against migrants, especially children. That's why I *opposed* the Senate border supplemental bill.
I'm deeply disappointed in today's #SCOTUS decision on gerrymandering. The people should choose their elected officials, not the other way around. This is a blow to representational democracy.

The conditions in the detention centers at our border are inhumane and kids are suffering. I joined a majority in the House yesterday in voting to provide humanitarian relief to those detained, but we must also ensure proper oversight and accountability measures are put in place.

Four years ago, SCOTUS made history by ruling same-sex couples have a constitutional right to marry. We've come a long way in the fight for LGBTQ equality, but still have much to do. I'm proud to support legislation that supports & protects our LGBTQ community. #LBGTQEqualityDay

The proposed pebble mine project could become the largest open pit mine in America covering up to 6.9 square miles and reaching a depth of as much as 3 quarters of a mile. To put that into perspective, the maximum depth of the Grand Canyon is one mile.

About 31% of the world’s wild sockeye harvest, which generates $1.5 billion annually & supports more than 10,000 U.S. jobs, depends on the Bristol Bay watershed. We must #StopPebble and #SaveBristolBay.

The Bristol Bay, Alaska watershed is home to the largest salmon run in the world and critical to the Alaska native villages, fishers, and businesses, but all of it is at risk if the Trump administration moves forward with the Pebble Mine project.

Today, my committee held a hearing on the impacts of the proposed Pebble Mine Project, pending review by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers. I believe it’s another example of an abuse of power by this administration. pic.twitter.com/WGnOy7H3pT
